alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 6:48PM EDT until July 21 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL FRANKLIN COUNTY... At 648 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported Route 105 East is closed just past Dairy Center Lane with water across the road. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Enosburg Falls, Berkshire, Enosburg Falls Village, Enosburg, Franklin, Sheldon, Richford, Fairfield, North Enosburg, West Berkshire, Enosburg Center, South Franklin, West Enosburg and East Sheldon. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
